channel.title: Database Layout
channel.description:
[ul]Hybridscape.com: [list] [li]General Server Info[/li] [li]All users - username,password,friendslist,ignorelist[/li][/list] (this is all that needs to stay central i think.)[/ul]
Game Server Specific:
[ul][li]Config[/li][/ul] - general configure
[ul][li]Npcs[/li][/ul] - npc id, name, combat level, xp gained, drops
[ul][li]Items[/li][/ul] - item id, name, price, alch price high and low, store buy price, store sell price.
[ul][li]Spawns[/li] [li]Dialouge[/li] [li]Users - username, invo, ect ect. will not contain friendslist, password, or ignore list. those will stay central. Will contain username for easy identification(may not be needed) not very strong with sql.[/li][/ul]
How the loginserver and game server will work (theory): User will register an account to play on hybridscape servers. Username password friends list and ignore list are all stored in this account. When that user logs into a gameserver, its first going to check the return code from the loginserver, if thats good it will retrieve the rest of the information from the gameservers table. (possible seperate database). The reasoning for this is for messaging between worlds. you need that information consistant. If you where to have the same user name on 2 different worlds it would cause problems.
